definitions.definition: Which reverses the order of morphism composition : formally, which associates each morphism f : X → Y {\displaystyle f:X\to Y} to a morphism F ( f ) : F ( Y ) → F ( X ) {\displaystyle F(f):F(Y)\to F(X)} .
Scaling inversely with a change of basis.

main_definition: ( category theory , of a functor ) Which reverses the order of morphism composition : formally, which associates each morphism f : X → Y {\displaystyle f:X\to Y} to a morphism F ( f ) : F ( Y ) → F ( X ) {\displaystyle F(f):F(Y)\to F(X)} .
secondary_definitions: ( object-oriented programming ) Using or relating to contravariance .
( linear algebra , of a vector ) Scaling inversely with a change of basis.
